Text:
All of you should know that you are welcome to zappateers to get zappa shows. There are even other sites like dime and tradersden that are OK. Downloading them from here is OK, just remember to mention who´s version it is if you trade them. You should always mention source and who did the digital work. Many people collection zappa-shows cares about that. Just be honest and it´ll be no problem. 

!zappacheers

SANTANA SUNDAY'S CONTINUES THIS WEEK

WITH AN INCREDIABLE SHOW !

STAY TUNED !

Santana Sundays Continues with

Festhalle, Frankfurt, Germany SBD 1ST GEN. A+

 Hannibal - All I Ever Wanted - Tales Of Kilimanjaro/Black Magic Woman/Gypsy Queen - Oye Como Va - Just In Time To See The Sun - Incident At Neshabur - Lightning In The Sky - Aqua Marine - Savor/Jingo - You Just Don't Care - Europa - Well All Right - Runnin - Soul Sacrifice - Open Invitation - Samba Pa Ti - She's Not There - Transcendance - Band Introduction - Shake Your Money Maker (1) - Evil Ways 
 W/Jimmy Page (1) 


recorded by carlos santana 

transferred and mastered by Ninja !	



http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3615697/Santana_7-1-80_frankfurt_sbd

I THOUGHT THIS WAS OVER BUT HEY IF YOU WANT TO BE INFENTILE AND DUMB 


ILL DO MY BEST TO PLAY ALONG ! 




Lineage: Aud master->DAT->cassette->CDR->EAC->SoundForge (speed correction, re-tracking)->FLAC Frontend 


The first show of the famous 1981 Halloween run at the Palladium. This recording, transferred from my tapes by JS, is 1st gen if you only count analog generations, and sounds quite nice. The sampling process also revealed that very small portions (0,7/1,9 secs) are missing here after the tape flips in the Drowning Witch and Yo Mama solos compared to Drew?s version, but I chose not to patch them in as there?s a little difference in sound. Unfortunately, we weren?t able to find any fills for the tape flips. 




this is what you call 1st . gen you cant be serious 


looks like 3rd gen to me dat is not lossless it uses tape! 





first of all this was recorded by steve h.

BTW, as I have mentioned in other threads, it appears that this was NOT recorded by Grape, although it was traded by him to Hot Rats.
